page.title: 16Ladock&Grampound Rd Housing
page.content: Grampound Road is a developing village with a modern housing estate, while Ladock ,2 miles away, has had less than 20 new houses built in the past 40 years. The few modern houses in Ladock are built of concrete blocks which are manufactured nearby. The majority of the houses are between 75 and 200 years old and are made of stone which is quarried locally. There are a few very old houses which are built of cob. A survey of houses in Grampound Road shows that most of the older houses were built when the station opened in the village in 1859. The very new ones have been built since it became usual for most families to have a car.Villagers need a car in order to get to work and to the towns.
